document.docAuthor: Liu, Zhen, He, Jun-Hua, Chen, Xue-Xin & Gupta, Ankita
document.masterDocTitle: The ater-group of the genus Apanteles Foerster (Hymenoptera, Braconidae, Microgastrinae) from China with the descriptions of forty-eight new species

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: The ater-group of the genus Apanteles Foerster (Hymenoptera, Braconidae, Microgastrinae) from China with the descriptions of forty-eight new species

bibRefCitation.author: Chen, J. H. & Song, D. B.
bibRefCitation.refString: Chen, J. H. & Song, D. B. (2004) Systematic studies on Microgastrinae of China (Hymenoptera: Braconidae). Fujian Scientific Publisher, Fuzhow, 354 pp. [in Chinese with English summary]

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Apanteles raviantenna
Chen & Song, 2004: 79
. Holotype ♀ — Hubei , China [FAFU].

subSubSection.paragraph: Diagnosis. Body length 2.7 mm , fore wing length 2.7 mm . Body mostly black, hind femur yellow. Posterior tangent to anterior ocellus touching posterior ocelli, distance between fore and hind ocellus about as long as diameter of hind ocellus. Antenna slightly shorter than body length, penultimate flagellomere as long as wide. Interspaces between punctures on disc of mesonotum distinctly smaller than its diameter. Areola on propodeum closed basally, V-shaped apically, with strong costulae. Pterostigma 2.8× as long as its widest part, vein 1-R1 1.3× longer than pterostigma, vein r 1.4× longer than vein 2-SR, angled at junction. T1 parallel-sided at anterior 2/3, narrowed at apical third, 1.5× longer than hind width, turned-over part slightly dull, strongly rugose, longitudinal channel indistinct; T2 shiny with fine wrinkles, 3.6× wider than long in the middle; T3 1.9× longer than T2. Ovipositor sheath as long as hind tibia.
